All I can say for now is that there are at least three continents on Runeterra.

1. Is Azir {{champion:268}} still a nice guy? what will happen when Taliyah meets him at last? 
2. Is Amumu {{champion:32}} one of Azir's death young brothers? or is he a Yordle? 
3. Weren't Malzahar {{champion:90}} and Kassadin {{champion:38}} Shurimian too? 
4. Would Taliyah be in the Azir team{{champion:268}} or the Xerath team {{champion:101}} ?

1. Personally, I don't think he's malevolent, but with people with such power (both physically and politically) they can be seen in various ways. I do think he might have a bit of a self-awareness issue though.
2. He is not one of Azir's dead young brothers, he's been around along time, even before Nasus ascended.
3. Although Shurima is prominent for both of them, the Void is of central importance.
4. She'd be on her family's team.

Just to nudge in here not to be rude but I see Azir as more of a leader who is only thinking of whats best for his people EVEN if they hate the idea.
kinda like how you would tell your kids to eat their greens even if they hate the idea.
He isn't nicey nice and pats kids on the head, he is more Regal and powerful (as he was raised that way like the pharaohs of old where raised to think they where the next things to gods)
He may be Arrogant but that's who he is and how he was raised.
However when the chips are down and the fate of the world is on the line, Shurima's Safety ALWAYS comes first to him before the rest of the world.
that's how I see Azir. 
{{champion:268}}

I've always seen Azir as having some really admirable attributes, and also some less admirable ones. His intentions were usually in the right place, but he certainly allowed his ego and position of power to cloud his leadership, ultimately leading to his betrayal. Hopefully, he's learned from that and is ready to be the type of emperor he always had the potential to be.  Only time will tell...
So he would try to be "friends" with Taliyah? Or at least try to don't look like a menace for her or her family?

Hey, some good questions there...

The magic Xerath uses is a blend of the dark magic he found in his researches, combined with the power he stole from the Ascension ritual, so it's kind of a blend of different strands of magic. Xerath Ascended in a different manner because the ritual wasn't keyed for him, it wasn't his to take, so the power intended for Azir affected him in a different way. The figure in the sarcophagus, well I could tell you but I'd be BRANDED with fire afterwards.

Ascension is a ritual usually decided upon by the Sun Priests, and usually it's granted to those who have selflessly served Shurima and are being given the chance to do so even after what would normally be their time to die. As to its deeper purpose, we'll we'd have to look into how and why it first came to Shurima to answer that one...

Hey Sharjo,

Great questions there, and I'll dive in now.

1 - Well, doing this when ALL THE BIOS were released might be a bit overwhelming for everyone. Doing it this way means we can address folks questions in manageable chunks without everyone's heads exploding. And we like to surprise even you now and again :-)

2 - Ascended beings were once, if not common, then at least much more prevalent in Ancient times. Over time the ritual has become less successful and more and more folk being offered it weren't surviving. After Azir's betrayal and the fall of Shurima, most of the knowledge of how to do the ritual properly has been lost or forgotten. There was once many warriors of the Ascended Host, but even they are not immortal and can be killed with the right weapon and enough bodies to throw at them.

3 - Expect to know more when Skarner's bio hits in the next couple of weeks. 

4 - I think it's a mixture of who you are and how the ritual is prepared that informs what you become. The ritual channels and hones the magic to make you into the being you need to be.

5 - I don't think there's any direct connection, but Nasus is certainly a being of great and deep wisdom, so he certainly understands that cycle, yeah. And an entity like Kindred would certainly be interested in those who have lived long past their day to die.

Hahaha... don't worry, we'll be here for a while, so get your head all unexplodey and we'll answer what we can!

Azir's return is still pretty fresh for the people of Shurima. The city of Shurima rose around a year before the events of The Bird and the Branch. For a nomadic, mercantile family like Taliyah's, the possibility of the return of an empire could have widespread ramifications for the basic elements of their way of life. But that can be said about most Shurimans.
